sources.name: What Is a Company Description? (Plus Key Elements and Tips) | Indeed.com
sources.snippet:
A company description is an overview or summary of a business. It's an important part of a business plan that often briefly describes an organization's history, location, mission statement, management personnel and, when appropriate, legal structure.
It's often important for human resources personnel and hiring managers to write a compelling company description, which is an important part of any business plan. As a unique summary of an organization, these descriptions typically include pertinent information of a business that entices customers, prospective employees and investors or lenders to engage.
If you want to persuade customers or investors to engage with your business, it may be helpful to learn how to write an effective company description.In this article, we define company descriptions, review their key elements, provide tips for writing and list examples you can reference when crafting your own.Related: Business Models and Business Plans: How They Differ
A company description is an overview or summary of a business. It's an important part of a business plan that often briefly describes an organization's history, location, mission statement, management personnel and, when appropriate, legal structure.
Whether you're writing the company description for the biography of your organization's website and social media pages or seeking support from investors, an interesting business description is helpful for promoting your business.A business description is most relevant when starting a company but is often effective when maintained regularly as a business grows.

sources.name: Company Description 7 Powerful Steps to Write One That Wins
sources.snippet:
A company description is the “biography” or the “about me” component of your company, that directly follows your executive summary.
In 2022, you are absolutely in need of an engaging business description that will be a creative profile on your website. Your business or company description will be used for review sites (Yelp, for example), the google business description, displayed on your own social media platforms (like Facebook), and more.
Keep it short: Tell someone about your business in 150-250 compelling and clear characters of brand purpose statements and company highlights. Build interest: Weave the elements of your bio and brand overview into a powerful and passionate story that shares what needs to be known in a way that makes the reader like you, trust you, and want to get to know more about you. Strong closing line: Be sure to close your description with a final, welcoming thought that leaves your reader wanting more.
A company description is the “biography” or the “about me” component of your company, that directly follows your executive summary.
It is a window – a general overview of your company and its purpose. The specific company philosophy is defined within the company description.

sources.name: How to Write a Company Description
sources.snippet:
Below is a sample company description, pulled from Target's annual report. Target Corporation (Target, the Corporation, or the Company) was incorporated in Minnesota in 1902. Our corporate purpose is to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. We offer to our customers, referred to as "guests," everyday essentials and fashionable, differentiated merchandise at discounted prices.
Once you've organized the key information that you want to include, you need to write the section in a way that will be appealing to readers. Follow five steps to help create a successful company description.
Begin the company description section with a paragraph that captures all of the vital information about your company. Imagine you are giving an elevator pitch about your company and want to express the key characteristics in just a few sentences.
When you're writing about the passion and excitement that led you to start your company, it can be easy to get carried away and use more words than necessary to get your point across. Once you've drafted your company description, go back and cut out any unnecessary parts or redundant information to make it clear and concise.
Below is a sample company description, pulled from Target's annual report. Target Corporation (Target, the Corporation, or the Company) was incorporated in Minnesota in 1902. Our corporate purpose is to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. We offer to our customers, referred to as "guests," everyday essentials and fashionable, differentiated merchandise at discounted prices.

sources.name: Check out this article...Business Description Examples: How to Write Yours
sources.snippet:
We provide custom software to help companies automate processes and improve efficiency." "ABC Boutique offers unique, handmade clothing for women, with a focus on eco-friendly fabrics and sustainable fashion. Based in Austin, TX, we’re proud to support local artisans." "Premier Legal Solutions is a law firm that provides expert legal advice to small businesses and startups. With offices in New York, we specialize in corporate law and contract negotiations." These descriptions cater to the specific expectations of each industry’s audience, ensuring that the business’s core message resonates with potential customers.
These examples showcase different approaches based on the nature of the business, while still communicating the core aspects of what makes each company unique. For small businesses, one big challenge when crafting a general business description is trying to include all the necessary information within a limited space.
Different industries may require tailored descriptions to better reflect their specific characteristics and appeal to their target audiences. Here are some examples to illustrate this: "XYZ Tech is a software development company that specializes in AI solutions for businesses.
We provide custom software to help companies automate processes and improve efficiency." "ABC Boutique offers unique, handmade clothing for women, with a focus on eco-friendly fabrics and sustainable fashion. Based in Austin, TX, we’re proud to support local artisans." "Premier Legal Solutions is a law firm that provides expert legal advice to small businesses and startups. With offices in New York, we specialize in corporate law and contract negotiations." These descriptions cater to the specific expectations of each industry’s audience, ensuring that the business’s core message resonates with potential customers.
By following these tips, you can craft a business description that effectively communicates your company's mission, services, and unique qualities.

People generally don't. Since you are not sure in what terms to describe your old companies, it seems likely you do not have any good reason to either. Employers are deciding whether to hire you, not buy shares in your old workplace.

sources.name: 10 creative company profile examples to inspire you [+ 8 templates]
sources.snippet:
Its website describes the company's history and mission. Still, a single line sticks out as a powerful and impactful description of its business to take inspiration from: “We are Dope Coffee Company, and we are changing the world one cup of coffee at a time.”
Its website describes the company's history and mission. Still, a single line sticks out as a powerful and impactful description of its business to take inspiration from: “We are Dope Coffee Company, and we are changing the world one cup of coffee at a time.”
What I like: The description opens with Miccolis' unique story and friendship. Carol H. Williams, an advertising agency, doesn’t have an “about” page or a formal company description.
However, it displays a snapshot of what the company is all about on its “Team” page. What I like: The description emphasizes its core values and uses trendy language (“#squadgoals”) to establish that it keeps up with the current trends.
Still, it does have a company description that clearly explains its mission and values in two short sentences: “Cafe con Libros (coffee with books) is an Intersectional Feminist community bookstore and coffee shop.

sources.name: Tips for Creating a Business Description | Chase for Business | chase.com
sources.snippet:
Company history — Provide a brief overview of when and why you started the business, as well as any changes in its size, structure and operations since its inception.
While it may seem challenging to embellish the business description when much of it follows a very fill-in-the-blank approach, like the business’s name and address, adding some personality to this section helps potential investors and others get a sense of your enthusiasm and passion for your business. This is especially important when you talk about the company’s history and the inspiration behind the business.
A business description is an important part of your business plan. Find out what it is and how to make it impactful.
Company history — Provide a brief overview of when and why you started the business, as well as any changes in its size, structure and operations since its inception.
Company strengths — Show potential investors/partners what makes your business unique. This section may require some research on your part.

sources.name: Company Profile: How to & company profile examples
sources.snippet:
A company profile is a concise but comprehensive overview of your business, usually in the form of an About page. This written description — sometimes paired with images and other content — highlights your company’s mission, values, and ...
Articulate your company's purpose and mission statements to help your audience understand the core values that drive your business. Try sorting them into bullet points to make them easier to read while highlighting your mission in a banner at the top. Engage your audience so they want to read more. Write a comprehensive description of what your company offers.
Get your business in the spotlight. Learn how to craft a compelling company profile to attract new customers, investors, and top talent to your brand.
You have an exciting history, a hardworking team, and products and services with tangible results — and it’s time to show them off. A company profile collects these elements into a captivating story that tells people exactly why they should buy from you, or work with you.
Include a section about how your company was founded to illustrate how passionate you are about your mission. Outline the organization's specific goals and highlight how you aim to help customers reach theirs.

sources.name: Executive Summary & Business Description - Business Plan Tutorial - Library Guides at University of Washington Libraries
sources.snippet:
A short summary (one to two pages) of the overall plan. The purpose of the executive summary is to get the reader interested. The summary is a space to introduce the most important aspects of the business plan. It is best to be brief; save the in-depth details for the business description.
A short summary (one to two pages) of the overall plan. The purpose of the executive summary is to get the reader interested. The summary is a space to introduce the most important aspects of the business plan. It is best to be brief; save the in-depth details for the business description.
Important: The executive summary and business description should be the last components written for a business plan.
The business description is a lead-in to the full plan.
The business description may need to be rewritten as the business plan is refined.

sources.name: How to write an effective business description
sources.snippet:
Luckily, there’s an easy formula to follow along with a few tips for writing an impactful business description. Also called a company description, your business description summarizes what your company does, its purpose, and what makes it unique.
Most successful businesses have one thing in common—they all have a buttoned-up business plan. It lays out the goals of the company, how a company will reach those goals, and when these goals will be realized. And while there are many sections of a business plan, a well-written business description is one of the most important parts.
However, some small business owners may not know how to write an effective business description. Luckily, there’s an easy formula to follow along with a few tips for writing an impactful business description. Also called a company description, your business description summarizes what your company does, its purpose, and what makes it unique.
Example: The business is a limited liability company owned by Jacob Doe. Once you’ve included all of these details in your business description, it should look something like this:
The company also intends to expand operations to an additional location in the Chicago area and is seeking an investment of $200,000 in exchange for equity in the company. Learn how to reach new customers, cultivate customer loyalty, and elevate your brand with this guide on online marketing for small business. Not all business descriptions are made the same.

Whether it’s for a business plan to get the support of investors or for the bio section of your website, writing a proper company description is crucial for promoting your business. When people visit your business website, social media page, etc.

Now that you’re aware of the importance of having a strong company description, let’s touch on a handful of company description examples that do a great job of upholding the values and principals of the company as well as holding the readers’ attention.

sources.name: How To Write a Company Overview (With Example and Tips) | Indeed.com
sources.snippet:
A company overview is a component of a formal business plan that outlines key information about a new organization. It typically summarizes details like the company's history, management structure, mission statement, location and legal organization.
For example, if you're presenting your plan to an investor who believes strongly in a customer-centered business approach, you might highlight this priority in the company overview document. This can show that you researched the investor's preferences beforehand and that your business may be compatible with their brand. After determining what to include in your overview and learning about your target audience, start writing a draft of your summary. During the drafting stage of the writing process, focus on filling each section of the overview with clear, descriptive content.
Learn about company overviews, including what they are and how to write them, with steps, examples of each section and some tips to help you write your own.
For business professionals, knowing how to write an effective company overview is an important skill. Company overviews can help you introduce a new o rganization, its goals and outline, so potential investors can better understand its overall value. Learning about company overviews, what they include and how to write one can help you create an effective overview for an organization.
A company overview is a component of a formal business plan that outlines key information about a new organization. It typically summarizes details like the company's history, management structure, mission statement, location and legal organization. Business professionals can use this document to introduce potential investors or other key stakeholders to a company by outlining its core values and goals.

sources.name: How to Write a Business Description (with Examples & Templates!)
sources.snippet:
What is a business description? It’s an overview of your company and how it’s different from your competitors.
There are so many places that you need to describe your business, whether it’s your website, an online directory, or even an “about the company” section for an event. Your mission statement is a good start, and your brand story is good background. But what you really need is a compelling business description that provides any reader with a quick overview of what your business does and what sets it apart from your competitors.
Your business description is an opportunity to introduce your company. That should include introducing your brand identity, too. You should write your description in your brand voice. For instance, if your brand voice is casual and jokey, use some light-hearted humor in your description.
Let’s call this bonus step six because when you’re done with your business description, you’re still not exactly done. The best business description is one that you can adapt slightly for any place you need to quickly introduce your company.
What is a business description? It’s an overview of your company and how it’s different from your competitors.

sources.name: How to Write A Company Description? | by SuperBusinessManager.com | Medium
sources.snippet:
A company description is a written summary of your business that explains what your company does, what it offers, and what makes it unique.
How to Write A Company Description? A company description is a written summary of your business that explains what your company does, what it offers, and what makes it unique. It is a vital part of …
Values: Highlight your company’s core values and how they guide your operations and decision-making. ... Brevity: Aim for a concise and easy-to-read description, ideally no more than one or two pages.
Seek feedback: Ask others to review your description and provide feedback on clarity, conciseness, and overall effectiveness. Update regularly: As your company evolves, update your company description to reflect any changes in your offerings, target market, or strategic direction.
Consider your audience: Adapt your company description to the specific audience you are targeting, whether it is investors, lenders, customers, or potential employees.

sources.name: 10+ Company Description Examples to Download
sources.snippet:
A company description provides key details about a business, including its name, founding year, location, mission, vision, core values, products/services, target market, unique selling proposition, history, organizational structure, achievements, financial highlights, customer and market insights, future plans, and contact information.
This introduction by the company gives people information about the company they are willing to do business with. This also gives job applicants a standard idea about the company they are applying for a job in. This set of information provided by a company is known as a company description.
Company description can be a simple description that is an integral part of the business plan of a company or it can be a job description available in the company. For more information, you may refer to Company Analysis Examples & Samples for samples.
A company description provides key details about a business, including its name, founding year, location, mission, vision, core values, products/services, target market, unique selling proposition, history, organizational structure, achievements, financial highlights, customer and market insights, future plans, and contact information.
The template is a company job description that gives job applicants basic information about the job position available. The template gives job applicants an idea about whether they are eligible to apply for the position.

step3_icp.data:
- **Target Industries:** Technology companies focused on AI applications, SaaS developers, enterprises requiring real-time corporate intelligence, legal and financial services leveraging AI for document and debtor insights, and businesses needing enriched company data for sales and marketing automation.

- **Company Sizes:** Mid-sized to large enterprises and startups with significant AI or data-driven workflows; customers include companies like Respaid, Cargo, Fleet, and Limnos, indicating a range from innovative startups to established firms.

- **Buyer Personas:** Product Directors, Chief Product Officers, Chief Operating Officers, AI developers, data scientists, and business intelligence teams who need accurate, real-time, and sourced data to power AI agents, chatbots, lead generation, CRM enrichment, competitor analysis, and strategic research.

- **Typical Use Cases:**
  - Powering AI agents with actionable, fact-based data to optimize team productivity.
  - Enabling AI chatbots and answer engines to deliver instant, accurate, and up-to-date information grounded in trusted sources.
  - Automated company profile enrichment for smarter decision-making and outreach.
  - Deep research and strategic risk analysis using comprehensive web data.
  - Enhancing sales strategies through lead generation, enrichment, and scoring with reliable data.
  - Integrations with AI orchestration platforms and workflows for seamless data access.

- **Key Characteristics and Patterns:**
  - Emphasis on factual, sourced, and legally compliant data for AI applications.
  - Flexible API integration supporting multiple programming languages and platforms.
  - Enterprise readiness with advanced performance, security, privacy compliance (GDPR, CCPA), and premium support.
  - Pricing models suitable for pay-as-you-go with no long-term commitment, appealing to both startups and enterprises.
  - Customers value Linkup for its ability to provide hard-to-find insights, real-time accuracy, and integration ease, making it a critical component in AI-driven business processes[1][2][3].

## Integration ready

Linkup is integrated with top AI orchestration platforms and Claude Desktop to power any agentic workflow.

Looking for a specific integration? Let us know - we’re always adding more.

[Get Started](https://app.linkup.so)

## Enterprise ready

### Advanced Performance

Tailored rate limits and early access to beta features and dedicated endpoints.

### Security & Privacy

Zero Data Retention, DPA, geo-specific data hosting. Encryption at rest and in transit.  
GDPR and CCPA compliant. SOC2 Type II in process.

### Custom Billing & Pricing

Flexible pricing models, finance-compliant invoicing, and custom billing flows.

### Premium Support

24/7 priority support, integration specialists, and dedicated communication channels.
